title: click magnet link and prompt window opens everytime
content: I click a magnet link and it keeps asking me what to do and I have already told it to do this automatically from now on. It even has the checkbox already ticked as if it is fkn retarded. I have refreshed firefox and nope I have uninstalled firefox and reinstalled it nope. I have checked all the forums about it and even made it so that the system cannot alter the default torrent program. Still, nothing works. I am so angry coz it used to be fine. So sick of updates that "fix" stuff... It would be nice if it just bloody worked.
creator: thomask9w

title: Firefox blocks my staging website which requires authentication
content:
I have a staging site for my website which is protected (not visible to the public) and requires authentication with the username and password to be accessed.

Firefox is blocking access with the authorisation window coming up empty again and again and again when I enter the credentials.

So - I have to use a different browser just to access this one site.

I have cleared the cookies and cache, removed the site from the browsing history - Firefox is still blocking the access.

how can I unblock it?

I use Windows 64 bits on my PC.
creator: magicpowers888

title: Annoying Outlines and square elements
content:
I've been trying to figure out why my browser looks weird in several locations. You can see in the screenshots that elements I know should be round are square and dark outlines are appearing in both browser and app elements (all shown by pointers). I've tried searching the settings for accessibility features that might be making things stand out but I could not find anything like that. Any ideas?

(And yes I know I misspelled "quiz" in that subject line. You have a good eye.)
creator: david.s.mattes

title: Firefox accesses Solidworks fonts folder
content:
Hi, lately I have been trying to tackle my secondary HDD being spun up for no reason in the background and one thing that keeps popping up is Firefox.exe accessing a bunch of fonts contained in the Solidworks installation on the HDD (which is a secondary drive, while Firefox is installed on the primary SSD).

I really cannot understand why it happens, since I think nobody is supposed to install Solidworks along with Firefox. Of course I don't want this activity to wake up my drive, but also, is it normal? I have to admit I'm kinda worried.

I'll attach screenshots from Sysinternals Process Monitor

Thanks in advance to anyone that will help :)
creator: carolift1

title: firefox randomly restarts a few times a day. no error no. no crash report. and not able to restore tabs.
content: so this happens a few times a day. my firefox randomly restarts and all tabs are gone. no error no notification nothing. it also happens in safe mode. i already tryed to "refresh" firefox that did not fix the issue. my firefox is up to date. im on windows 10 which is als up to date. please advise cause its driving me crazy to lose my tabs every few hours..

title: Access Denied
content:
Ever since the last update (88.0.1), I have been unable to login to my bank, or IRS sites. SOMETIMES, if i clear cookes and cache, i can get into my bank, but then when i logout, i get the access denied message again, and can't log back in. These same sites work with no issue in Chrome.

This is infuriating. Can anything be done to fix this, or am i going to be stuck waiting for the next firefox update?

title: Problema com mecanismo de pesquisa: potencial problema de segurança
content:
Boa noite! Então, estou tendo problemas em pesquisar termos no Google pela barra de pesquisa. O Firefox alega "Não conectou: Potencial problema de segurança", mas, dando uma lida nas informações do erro, percebo que há escrito:

[...] O Firefox não confia neste site porque ele usa um certificado que não é válido para www.google.com. O certificado só é válido para os seguintes nomes: www.google.com.br, *.google.com.br, google.com.br

E, então, mudei a url da barra de pesquisa de google.com (que o mecanismo de pesquisa adiciona automaticamente) para google.com.br e funcionou. Pois bem, quero mudar o mecanismo de pesquisa para que ele adicione o ".br" automaticamente, mas não consigo achar onde e nem como. É possível?

Grato.
creator: mateushirt000

title: Firefox developer tools response garbarge
content:
Hi, I'm having an issue with Firefox developer tools response in the network tab. When I look at the response it's all garbage but when I look at it in Chrome or Charles proxy it looks fine.

To replicate: 1. Go to https://www.realestate.com.au/new-homes/ 2. Open up developer tools, switch to network tab and filter by .mst 2. On the webpage click `Explorer` sub menu item 3. Inspect the response of the .mst requests and it's garbage like: PHN0eWxlIHR5cGU9InRleHQvY3NzIj4uc3RhbmRhcmRfX3N0YW5kYXJkLWNvbnRhaW5lcl9fXzFGVFJ3e21heC13aW
creator: george1319

title: Won't open certain pdf files and crashes
content:
Firefox v88.0.1 on Win 10 Pro 20H2 PC, Windows Security (Windows Defender). All fully up-to-date.

This problem only started recently: When link is clicked in FF to open certain pdf files, a new, fully formatted FF window opens, but the body is blank white and the pdf never loads. Doesn't happen with all pdf files listed on the "referring" page, but just some of them on a certain well-known and trusted web site, and it's very reproducible.

Setting FF to open pdf files in Adobe Reader doesn't help. Same ones open but the others still won't. Other people tell me they have no problems opening those pdf files in FF.

I completely uninstalled and re-installed FF but that didn't help. Doesn't matter how I set the security/privacy options, have Ghostery on or off (only extension installed). Use recommended performance settings is enabled, DNS over HTTPS is off, tracking protection can be standard or strict, etc.

If I click Manage Exceptions under Enhanced Tracking Protection, there's no way to enter any exceptions so I can't exempt the website in question.

If I keep trying to open one of those pdf files, FF becomes totally unresponsive. Task Manager lists ~4-5 FF entries but I can't End Task for most of them, and I typically have to reboot PC. Windows creates a firefox.dmp file which says: FAULTING_THREAD: 000012f8 PROCESS_NAME: firefox.exe ERROR_CODE: (NTSTATUS) 0x80000003 - {EXCEPTION} Breakpoint A breakpoint has been reached. EXCEPTION_CODE_STR: 80000003

I've run out of things to try...

Any ideas ?

Thanks!
creator: rohe1318
